snippet: The government sought a 136-year prison term for Pfc. Bradley Manning, saying his leaks eroded trust among nations and between American soldiers and Afghans.
abstract: Prosecutors in trial of Pfc Bradley Manning seek, as sentencing phase begins, to prove his disclosure of classified information to WikiLeaks has sown mistrust and damaged United States; suggest maximum sentence of 136 years in prison, but legal experts say it is unlikely that Manning will receive a sentence that long.
lead_paragraph: The government sought a 136-year prison term for Pfc. Bradley Manning, saying his leaks eroded trust among nations and between American soldiers and Afghans.

headline.main: In Sentencing, U.S. Tries to Prove Harm by Manning
headline.print_headline: U.S. Tries to Prove Harm From Leaks by Manning

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
